[b][color=white]Forum Subscription Changes[/color][/b]
There are slight changes in the Forum Subscription. Now, one can select the notification type. [i][size=x-small][url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=6102055]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Convo Jackpot Bytes Game[/color][/b]
Now users can play Bytes Game in the HF Convo and get a chance to win the Jackpot. [i][size=x-small][url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=6102738]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Follow a Member Notifications[/color][/b]
HF is thinking of adding a notification system for new threads by a member if you follow that particular member. Share your opinions. [i][size=x-small][url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=6102732]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

posts.subject: Hack Forums News // Edition 480

posts.message:
[font=Trebuchet MS][size=medium][color=transparent]       [/color]
[color=transparent]       [/color]

[align=center][url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=4570721][img]https://hackforums.news/assets/v4/animenews-megane.png[/img][/url][/align]

[b][color=white]The Seven Deadly Sins Final Arc to Air in January 2021![/color][/b]
The final arc of "The Seven Deadly Sins" anime has scheduled to air in January of next year and has been given the name "Dragon's Judgement." An [url=https://resize.cdn.otakumode.com/resize/1600/u/ef4985d0abb54098b8c30b5ac7faa68f.jpg]image teaser[/url] was released showcasing Meliodas, Elizabeth, Hawk, and other members of the anime. [i][size=x-small][url=https://otakumode.com/news/5f27c85b3a4c5d626b47517e/The-Seven-Deadly-Sins-Final-Arc-to-Air-in-January-2021!]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Ikki Tousen, Elfen Lied's Studio Arms Declares Bankruptcy[/color][/b]
Known for their works on anime such as Ikki Tousen and Elfen Lied, the studio Arms has recently declared bankruptcy. Arms were founded in 1996 and are also known for their collaboration with adult anime (hentai) companies, such as Pink Pineapple and Green Bunny. The company held a meeting this spring and then pulled the plug on July 22. [i][size=x-small][url=https://www.animenewsnetwork.com/news/2020-08-05/ikki-tousen-elfen-lied-studio-arms-declares-bankruptcy/.162581]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Bandai Namco Collectibles Holds Gundam Online Expo in U.S.A.[/color][/b]
Bandai Namco will be hosting a 10-day online expo starting from August 20 to August 31. The event will take place in the US, and this is the first time Gundam has held an online event. There will be an exhibit of the "Gunpla World Ver.MG" and even a virtual viewing of the Gundam base in Tokyo, Japan. For the die-hard fans, you will be able to purchase merchandise throughout the event. [i][size=x-small][url=https://www.animenewsnetwork.com/news/2020-08-05/bandai-namco-collectibles-holds-gundam-online-expo-in-u.s.a/.162582]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Demon Slayer: Kimetsu no Yaiba Film's New Trailer Previews LiSA's New Song[/color][/b]
A Tweet was recently posted in regards to the Demon Slayer: Kimetsu no Yaiba movie that has been announced to hit American and Canadian theatres in 2021. In the [url=https://twitter.com/DemonSlayerUSA/status/1289909299276259329?s=20]Tweet[/url], we get a preview of the new theme song that is sung by LiSA! The video has also provided English subtitles for you. If that video does not make you excited for the movie, then are you truly a fan of the series?! [i][size=x-small][url=website]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]KLab Partners with Electronic Arts on New Mobile Title[/color][/b]
KLab is tremendously known for their gacha games, and we even wrote an article about them last week. To keep up with competitors, KLab is always coming up with new ideas on games that they think will bring weebs more enjoyment. Something you may not have ever thought coming is about to happen! KLab is parterning with Electronic Arts to work on a new game. There is no information on what the game is, but when more is released on the matter you will learn more from the wonderful anime section of the Hack Forums News. (Sorry I had to plug that -Megane) [i][size=x-small][url=https://www.animenewsnetwork.com/news/2020-08-06/klab-partners-with-electronic-arts-on-new-mobile-title/.162633]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Crunchyroll, Funimation Add Sword Art Online: Alicization Anime's English Dub[/color][/b]
As of the writing of this article, all English dub episodes have been released on Crunchyroll for the "Sword Art Online: Alicization" anime. For those wondering, this is the first part of the Alicization series, which aired in 2018. The English dub first premiered on Adult Swim's Toonami in 2019. There has been no announcement regarding "Sword Art Online: Alicization War of Underworld Part 2" getting a dub anytime soon, but it should be expected if the first season was dubbed already. [i][size=x-small][url=https://www.animenewsnetwork.com/news/2020-08-07/crunchyroll-funimation-add-sword-art-online-alicization-anime-english-dub/.162705]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]'Is It Wrong to Try to Pick Up Girls in a Dungeon? Infinite Combate' Delayed on PC in the West by 1-3 Weeks[/color][/b]
Due to "development issues," the "Is It Wrong to Try to Pick Up Girls in a Dungeon? Infinite Combate" game has been delayed for an estimated 1-3 weeks. The game was supposed to debut on August 7 in Europe and August 11 for North America via Steam, Switch, and PS4. "Development issues" can mean anything, as this can just be a placeholder for information they do not want to share with the public. This is the second time the game has been put on a delay, as it was originally supposed to release to the west in the spring. [i][size=x-small][url=https://www.animenewsnetwork.com/news/2020-08-05/is-it-wrong-to-try-to-pick-up-girls-in-a-dungeon-infinite-combate-delayed-on-pc-in-the-west-by-1-3-weeks/.162601]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Wotakoi: Love is Hard for Otaku Manga Gets New Anime Episode[/color][/b]
In 2021, "Wotakoi: Love is Hard for Otaku" will be getting a new anime episode with the release of the 10th manga edition. In celebration of over 10 million copies being sold, Fujita drew a new [url=https://cdn.animenewsnetwork.com/thumbnails/max700x700/cms/news.3/162578/wotakoi_kinen.jpg]illustration[/url] celebrating the achievement! A little easter egg is included, as you can see Rem and Ram from "Re:Zero" also included! Also, feel free to check out a funny and cute [url=https://youtu.be/9Rhp10xk_LU]video[/url] also created for the achievement. Sadly, it's only in Japanese. (But Megane how do you know it's cute?!) [i][size=x-small][url=https://www.animenewsnetwork.com/news/2020-08-04/wotakoi-love-is-hard-for-otaku-manga-gets-new-anime-episode/.162578]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Toei, Kodansha, Other Anime Firms Launch YouTube Initiative With Overseas Plans[/color][/b]
A cool new concept is in the making as the Toei Animation team will be collaborating with YouTube to legally distribute family-friendly anime. They state this will guarantee a safe viewing. The [url=https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCsnDtu-g18tDA4miToMOjXQ]YouTube[/url] channel has already launched and is named "AnimeLog アニメログ" (アニメログ translation = Anime Log.) The channel will provide over 3,000 anime titles from various companies by the end of 2022. If you think about it, that is insane!

There might be a location block, as it says the channel is only available in Japan. The article also goes into detail saying that Future Boy Conan and Black Jack have been uploaded to the channel already. Toei instens on releasing English and Chinese subtitles for the anime so maybe western countries will have access to the channel eventually. [i][size=x-small][url=https://www.animenewsnetwork.com/news/2020-08-07/toei-kodansha-other-anime-firms-launch-youtube-initiative-with-overseas-plans/.162682]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]HIDIVE to Stream Peter Grill and the Philosopher's Time Anime's English Dub[/color][/b]
Peter Grill and the Philosopher's Time is an anime that not too many people expected to air this season. The reason being it is an ecchi anime out of the blue with a harem. It revolves around a fighter named Peter Grill who is labeled as the strongest fighter in the world. Given this title as the strongest fighter in the world, various women from around the world are seeking Peter to put it bluntly bear his children. In the anime, we see the struggle of Peter Grill who never would have imagined that so many women would try and get with him. To make things awkward, he is engaged to the guild master's daughter. If you are of age to watch such a show and are wanting to watch this with an English dub instead of the Japanese original, you will soon be able to do so on August 14 on HIDIVE. A bigger plus is that the first four episodes of the anime (there are five Japanese subtitled episodes out as the writing of this) will be released. [i][size=x-small][url=https://www.animenewsnetwork.com/news/2020-08-07/hidive-to-stream-peter-grill-and-the-philosopher-time-anime-english-dub/.162707]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]My Hero Academia Gets New Original Anime Episode Streaming on August 16[/color][/b]
In Japan on August 16, My Hero Academia will be releasing a new episode on Hulu Japan, most likely preparing us for the fifth season. The episode is scheduled to release outside of Japan at the end of the month. The title of the episode is, "Boku no Hero Academia: Ikinokore! Kesshi no Survival Kunren" (My Hero Academia: Survive! Do-or-Die Survival Training.) Taken from the article:
[quote]
The episode takes place right before the provisional pro hero license exam. Class 1-A is divided into two teams to practice disaster relief scenarios. In the drill, a fire has broken out at an underground shopping mall, and the teams must save dummies placed in the area, serving as people left behind in the mall. As Deku and his team of 10 people start looking for victims to save, an area collapses and traps them underground. In addition, there are also more threats of other areas collapsing, the electricity has gone out, and the air is getting thin. Deku and his team must work together with their Quirks to escape and survive.
[/quote]
[i][size=x-small][url=https://www.animenewsnetwork.com/news/2020-08-02/my-hero-academia-gets-new-original-anime-episode-streaming-on-august-16/.162485]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Pokémon the Movie: Koko's 2nd Trailer Reveals Christmas Opening, Theme Song[/color][/b]
Two new trailers have been released for the newest movie in the Pokémon series, "Pokémon  the Movie: Coco." The [url=https://youtu.be/IWr67AQjMDI]first trailer[/url] reveals that the movie will be released to Japanese theatres on Christmas of this year, and the [url=https://youtu.be/yX9Jq0tyWc8]second[/url] trailer showcases the theme song. Due to the coronavirus, the anime was delayed from its original viewing of July 10. Tickets in Japan are on sale as of now, so if you will be there during Christmas time snag a ticket now!

The cast of the film has been announced as:
[list]
[*]Shoko Nakagawa as Karen, a female researcher
[*]Kankurō Nakamura as Zarude
[*]Moka Kamishiraishi as Koko
[*]Kōichi Yamadera as Professor Zed, a Biotope Company researcher of cutting-edge technology whom Satoshi (Ash) meets when he visit Okoya Forest
[/list]
You can also check out a visual [url=https://cdn.animenewsnetwork.com/thumbnails/max650x650/cms/news.3/162410/pokemon-koko-cast.jpg]here[/url] of the cast members. [i][size=x-small][url=https://www.animenewsnetwork.com/news/2020-08-05/pokemon-the-movie-koko-2nd-trailer-reveals-christmas-opening-theme-song/.162590]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Virtual Crunchyroll Expo Releases More Guests[/color][/b]
More guests have been announced to appear at this year's Crunchyroll Expo. The following have been confirmed to appear as virtual guests:
[list]
[*]Yongje Park, The God of High School series creator
[*]Masahiko Komino, Gibiate anime's director and character designer
[*]Sōma Saitō, voice actor of Tadashi Yamaguchi in Haikyu!! anime
[*]Yoshikatsu Kimura, EX-ARM anime's director
[*]Writer Jeho Son and artist Kwangsu Lee of Noblesse manwha
[*]Tsukasa Kiryu, So I'm a Spider, So What? light novel's artist
[*]Cast members from Rent-A-Girlfriend including: Sora Amamiya (Chizuru Mizuhara), Aoi Yūki (Mami Nanami), Nao Tōyama (Ruka Sarashina), and Rie Takahashi (Sumi Sakurasawa).
[*]Staff of The Hidden Dungeon Only I Can Enter including: director Kenta Onishi (Little Witch Academia key animator, My Roommate is a Cat episode director), line producer Yuki Yamada (Baby Steps, My Roommate is a Cat), and editor of light novel series and manga adaptation Satoshi Shoji
[*]Okina Baba, So I'm a Spider, So What? light novel's author
[/list]

However, for those unaware, the event will take place online virtually due to the COVID pandemic. The event will be taking place on Sep. 4-6. The Crunchyroll [url=https://expo.crunchyroll.com]website[/url] dedicated to the event has dubbed the location "Crunchy City" which is very cute. Adding just a little bit like this to add some uniqueness is never a bad thing. This might mean that the layout of the event might look like an anime city filled with panels of your favorite series! Or maybe it is just a regular old convention. Boo! Jokes aside, registration is free and you can purchase a free ticket [url=https://purchase.growtix.com/eh/Crunchyroll_Expo_2020]here[/url]. The next event that you can physically attend has been rescheduled for August of next summer in California. [i][size=x-small][url=https://www.animenewsnetwork.com/news/2020-08-07/virtual-crunchyroll-expo-event-features-the-god-of-high-school-series-creator-yongje-park-director-masahiko-komino-more/.162709]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[align=center][url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2774521][img]https://www.hackforums.news/assets/v4/cryptonews-james.png[/img][/url][/align]

[b][color=white]Coca Cola Meets Ethereum[/color][/b]
Blockchain technology is becoming more prevalent in enterprise environments. More and more businesses are looking at the vast array of use cases and are exploring methods of incorporating it into their workflow. Coca Cola is one of those. In an August 3 announcement, Coke One North America (CONA) outlined their plans to use the Baseline protocol. CONA is one of the largest partners of the Coca Cola bottling network in the United States and can influence how the industry as a whole uses blockchain technology. They previously experimented with a Hyperledger Fabric blockchain infrastructure that aided in supply chain management. It reportedly increased "transparency and efficiency" in their complex supply chain networks. The Baseline Protocol takes advantage of the Ethereum blockchain and aids in maintaining consistency between different records.[i][size=x-small][url=https://cointelegraph.com/news/coca-cola-embraces-dlt-and-ethereum-for-supply-chain-efficiency] >>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Ethereum Classic 51% Attack[/color][/b]
Ethereum Classic experienced two almost identical 51% attacks within just seven days. A 51% attack is where a miner, or group of miners, controls more than half of a coin's overall mining hash rate. It can lead to a rather concerning problem. The miner(s) would be able to control which transactions go through and get confirmed. A double-spend attack would be rather easy to execute while carrying out a 51% attack. The attackers could potentially delay the transactions and confirm the second TX before even considering confirming the first one. For both attacks, the malicious actor spent a few hundred thousand dollars renting hash power from DaggerHashimoto. Almost one million Ethereum Classic was double spent, reaching nearly seven million dollars, and is suspected of having since been converted to other cryptocurrencies. Ethereum Classic Labs is looking to take legal action.[i][size=x-small][url=https://decrypt.co/37988/hacker-swiped-1-7-million-second-ethereum-classic-attack] >>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]'Crypto Mom' Gets a Second Term[/color][/b]
Commissioner Hester Peirce of the United States Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) is getting a second term in office, lasting until 2025. She has been a monumental figure in moving the SEC towards a world where cryptocurrencies are more widely accepted. During her first term, she was dubbed as the 'crypto mom,' due to her enthusiasm and dedication towards regulating cryptocurrency in a recognized manner. In February of 2020, Peirce presented a proposal that would seek to allow developers to have a grace period where the SEC would not pursue legal action against them, for the first three years that they spent developing a decentralized network. It was described as "the most groundbreaking development for the U.S. cryptocurrency market." Furthermore, Peirce has publically disagreed with the SEC's stand in some cases, like their rejection of Wilshire Phoenix’s Bitcoin Exchange Traded Fund application.[i][size=x-small][url=https://cointelegraph.com/news/crypto-mom-sec-commissioner-hester-pierce-voted-in-until-2025] >>Source[/url][/size][/i]
